name: Boston Fern
description: Nephrolepis hirsutula, commonly known as Boston Fern, is a terrestrial fern native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India, Sri Lanka, and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Nephrolepidaceae family and features arching fronds (60-120 cm long) with large, dramatic, finely divided, dark green fronds. The plant displays an arching growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant provides lush, feathery texture to any environment. It's extremely popular among fern enthusiasts for its easy care and attractive appearance.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Avoid direct sunlight - prefers bright indirect light
Brown edges indicate low humidity or underwatering
